topic: Generative Foundation Models (GenFMs)

  entities:
    Generative Foundation Models|Research Field
    BERT|Model
    GPT-4|Model
    DALLE-3|Model
    Large Language Models|Research Field

  proposition: Foundation models are distinguished by extensive use of massive datasets and computational resources during pre-training.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Foundation models|CHARACTERIZED_BY|extensive use of massive datasets
    Foundation models|CHARACTERIZED_BY|extensive computational resources during pre-training

  proposition: Foundation models can generalize effectively across diverse applications.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Foundation models|CAPABILITY|effective generalization across diverse applications

  proposition: Non-generative foundation models like BERT are primarily designed for text classification and language understanding.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    BERT|DESIGNED_FOR|text classification
    BERT|DESIGNED_FOR|language understanding

  proposition: Generative foundation models (GenFMs) are specifically adapted for generative tasks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|ADAPTED_FOR|generative tasks

  proposition: GenFMs excel in creating new instances such as images, texts, or other data forms based on their training.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|CAPABILITY|creating new instances
    Generative Foundation Models|CAPABILITY|generating images
    Generative Foundation Models|CAPABILITY|generating texts

  proposition: GenFMs are large-scale, pre-trained architectures that leverage extensive pre-training to excel in generative tasks across various modalities and domains.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|SCALE|large-scale
    Generative Foundation Models|CHARACTERISTIC|pre-trained architectures
    Generative Foundation Models|CAPABILITY|excel in generative tasks across modalities and domains

  proposition: GenFMs have transformative potential in research and practical applications.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|POTENTIAL|transformative in research
    Generative Foundation Models|POTENTIAL|transformative in practical applications

topic: Trustworthiness Challenges of GenFMs

  entities:
    GPT-4|Model
    DALLE-3|Model
    Large Language Models|Research Field

  proposition: Advanced models like GPT-4 have demonstrated vulnerabilities to novel attacks such as "jailbreak" exploits.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    GPT-4|VULNERABILITY|susceptible to jailbreak exploits

  proposition: GenFMs can bypass intended safeguards.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|CAPABILITY|bypassing intended safeguards

  proposition: Text-to-image models like DALLE-3 have been manipulated to bypass safety filters.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    DALLE-3|VULNERABILITY|manipulated to bypass safety filters

  proposition: Large Language Models (LLMs) have raised serious concerns about privacy leaks.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Large Language Models|CONCERN|privacy leaks

  proposition: GenFMs can generate realistic outputs that are often indistinguishable from human-created content.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|CAPABILITY|generating realistic outputs
    Generative Foundation Models|CHARACTERISTIC|outputs indistinguishable from human-created content

  proposition: Potential risks of GenFMs include spread of misinformation, creation of deepfakes, and amplification of biased narratives.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|RISK|spread of misinformation
    Generative Foundation Models|RISK|creation of deepfakes
    Generative Foundation Models|RISK|amplification of biased narratives

topic: Complexity of GenFM Trustworthiness

  proposition: GenFMs are pre-trained on massive, heterogeneous datasets, allowing generalization across wide application ranges.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|TRAINING_DATA|massive, heterogeneous datasets
    Generative Foundation Models|CAPABILITY|generalization across wide application ranges

  proposition: The broad versatility of GenFMs introduces significant challenges in assessing trustworthiness.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|CHARACTERISTIC|broad versatility
    Generative Foundation Models|CHALLENGE|assessing trustworthiness

  proposition: GenFMs require evaluation across diverse tasks and contexts to ensure consistent reliability and ethical standards.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|REQUIREMENT|evaluation across diverse tasks
    Generative Foundation Models|REQUIREMENT|evaluation across diverse contexts
    Generative Foundation Models|GOAL|ensuring consistent reliability
    Generative Foundation Models|GOAL|maintaining ethical standards

  proposition: GenFMs have potential to shape public opinion, influence policy decisions, and generate content mimicking authoritative sources.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|POTENTIAL|shaping public opinion
    Generative Foundation Models|POTENTIAL|influencing policy decisions
    Generative Foundation Models|CAPABILITY|generating content mimicking authoritative sources

  proposition: The scale and complexity of GenFMs, often with billions of parameters, make them inherently opaque and difficult to interpret.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|SCALE|billions of parameters
    Generative Foundation Models|CHARACTERISTIC|opaque
    Generative Foundation Models|CHARACTERISTIC|difficult to interpret

  proposition: The dynamic nature of GenFMs complicates maintaining consistent safety protocols and establishing traceability.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Generative Foundation Models|CHARACTERISTIC|dynamic nature
    Generative Foundation Models|CHALLENGE|maintaining consistent safety protocols
    Generative Foundation Models|CHALLENGE|establishing traceability

topic: Key Events in AI Development (2024-2025)

  entities:
    Deepseek-R1|Model
    OpenAI o3-mini|Model
    International AI Safety Report|Project
    IBM Granite Guardian|Model
    European Artificial Intelligence Act|Project
    OpenAI o1|Model
    GPT-4o|Model
    Llama 3|Model
    Gemini Flash|Model
    Seoul Declaration|Project
    TrustLLM|Tool
    GPT-4-turbo|Model
    Grok|Model
    UK AI Safety Institute|Organization
    Deepmind|Research Institution

  proposition: Deepseek-R1 was released in December 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Deepseek-R1|RELEASE_DATE|December 2024

  proposition: OpenAI o3-mini was released in December 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    OpenAI o3-mini|RELEASE_DATE|December 2024

  proposition: International AI Safety Report was released in December 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    International AI Safety Report|RELEASE_DATE|December 2024

  proposition: IBM Granite Guardian was released in December 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    IBM Granite Guardian|RELEASE_DATE|December 2024

  proposition: The European Artificial Intelligence Act entered into force in August 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    European Artificial Intelligence Act|EFFECTIVE_DATE|August 2024

  proposition: OpenAI o1 was released in August 2024 with higher reasoning ability and stronger safety performance.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    OpenAI o1|RELEASE_DATE|August 2024
    OpenAI o1|CAPABILITY|higher reasoning ability
    OpenAI o1|PERFORMANCE|stronger safety performance

  proposition: GPT-4o, Llama 3, and Gemini Flash were released in August 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    GPT-4o|RELEASE_DATE|August 2024
    Llama 3|RELEASE_DATE|August 2024
    Gemini Flash|RELEASE_DATE|August 2024

  proposition: The Seoul Declaration was adopted at the 2024 AI Seoul Summit in April 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    Seoul Declaration|ADOPTION_DATE|April 2024
    Seoul Declaration|EVENT|2024 AI Seoul Summit

  proposition: TrustLLM was released for evaluating trustworthiness of LLMs in April 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    TrustLLM|RELEASE_DATE|April 2024
    TrustLLM|PURPOSE|evaluating trustworthiness of LLMs

  proposition: GPT-4-turbo and Grok were released in January 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    GPT-4-turbo|RELEASE_DATE|January 2024
    Grok|RELEASE_DATE|January 2024

  proposition: UK AI Safety Institute was established in January 2024.
    entity-attribute relationships:
    UK AI Safety Institute|ESTABLISHMENT_DATE|January 2024

  proposition: Deepmind demonstrated how to extract ChatGPT's training data in January 2024.
    entity-entity relationships:
    Deepmind|DEMONSTRATED|ChatGPT
    Deepmind|DEMONSTRATED|training data extraction
